entries.name: DEBUG
entries.desc: Debugging error level for messages used in server development or debugging

entries.name: ERROR
entries.desc: Error log level which indicates a recoverable error

entries.name: FATAL
entries.desc: Fatal log level which indicates a server crash

entries.name: INFO
entries.desc: Information log level which indicates possibly useful information

entries.name: WARN
entries.desc: Warning log level which indicates a possible problem

entries.name: level
entries.desc: log-level, messages above this level will be logged

entries.name: new(log_file=nil, level=nil)
entries.desc: Initializes a new logger for log_file that outputs messages at level or higher.  log_file can be a filename, an IO-like object that responds to << or nil which outputs to $stderr.

entries.name: <<(obj)
entries.desc: Synonym for log(INFO, obj.to_s)

entries.name: close()
entries.desc: Closes the logger (also closes the log device associated to the logger)

entries.name: debug(msg)
entries.desc: Shortcut for logging a DEBUG message

entries.name: debug?()
entries.desc: Will the logger output DEBUG messages?

entries.name: error(msg)
entries.desc: Shortcut for logging an ERROR message

entries.name: error?()
entries.desc: Will the logger output ERROR messages?

entries.name: fatal(msg)
entries.desc: Shortcut for logging a FATAL message

entries.name: fatal?()
entries.desc: Will the logger output FATAL messages?

entries.name: info(msg)
entries.desc: Shortcut for logging an INFO message

entries.name: info?()
entries.desc: Will the logger output INFO messages?

entries.name: log(level, data)
entries.desc: Logs data at level if the given level is above the current log level.

entries.name: warn(msg)
entries.desc: Shortcut for logging a WARN message

entries.name: warn?()
entries.desc: Will the logger output WARN messages?
